meanings.definition: In a way that causes unease or discomfort.
meanings.sent1: The dark shadows moved unsettlingly across the room, making me feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The sudden noise outside the window made me jump unsettlingly.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared unsettlingly at the vacuum cleaner, unsure whether to attack or run away.
meanings.sent4: The eerie silence in the abandoned house settled unsettlingly in my bones.
meanings.sent5: The fog rolled in, enveloping the town in an unsettlingly thick blanket.

meanings.definition: In a manner that disrupts or disturbs.
meanings.sent1: The construction work outside disrupted the peaceful neighborhood unsettlingly.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party disturbed the neighbors unsettlingly late into the night.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel unsettlingly knocked over the bird feeder, causing chaos in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected power outage disrupted the entire street unsettlingly, leaving everyone in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The storm raged on, unsettlingly shaking the windows and doors of the old house.
